content:
Set’s Speed Mafia

Welcome to Setville, where the carnival is in town. Less and less of the townsfolk dare visit the fair now that so many strange, unexplained accidents have been happening. It is starting to become clear that these deaths are not accidental, but have been carefully plotted by murderous fiends. A group of you have banded together and vowed to root out the killers and bring them to justice, but you are very short on time. The carnival leaves town in only a few days. If you do not find them before then, the carnival will move on and, if carnies are involved, they will surely wreak havoc on the next unsuspecting town.

ALIVE
1. Swankidelic Pine
8. SpyreX
10. TwistedSpoon Magic Trainer

DEAD
rblinker123, vanilla townie, lynched Day 1
YankCane151, vanilla townie, throat slit Night 1
Does Bo Know, Michael Bradshaw, 2-shot Vigilante, electrocuted Night 1
Junpei, Smiley, Mafia Jack of all Trades, lynched Day 2
SensFan, Lefty, Town Odd Night Tracker, strangled Night 2.
Noramp, Snuggles, Town 1-shot Jailkeeper, lynched Day 3.
Cyberbob, Sarah Welch, Mafia Even Night Tracker, lynched Day 4.
Beck, Scrub, Town 1-shot Tracker, bludgeoned Night 4.
Ranmaru, vanilla townie, lynched Day 5.
Toast, vanilla townie, drowned Night 5.




This is a speed game. Days will last 72 hours. Nights will last 24 hours.

Rule set

> Fundamental
1) The site-wide rules apply, please read them and don't do anything stupid.
2) Unless it is explicitly stated in your role PM that you can do so, do not talk about this game outside of the game thread.
3) Do not quote any communication you have with me, the moderator of the game. Depending on the circumstance, you may be able to paraphrase things I have sent you (such as a role PM). Use common sense and if you are unsure feel free to ask me via PM. This includes timestamps of role pm's. You may share the quotation in your role pm, if there is one, however. This doesn't have to be paraphrased.
4) Be courteous to your fellow player. This is just a game - please don't bring personal grudges into the game. Try and keep it civil.
4a) No Sig/Avatar bets, I can't have someone having an awful avatar as a result of my game.

> Voting, Lynching & Death
5) For your vote to be counted, it must be bold, and in the form Vote: Hoopla. Caps and colons are optional, but it must be bolded.
6) Unvotes aren't necessary, but will be appreciated.
7) A lynch will occur when a player achieves 50% +1 of the votes. When this has happened, any subsequent votes and unvotes will not be counted, and the game will enter twilight. Night will begin as soon as I have declared the lynch.
8) You may vote for a ‘no lynch’ if desired. If a majority of the players in the game vote for a no lynch, the game will progress to night without a lynch.
9) Once you're dead, you are dead. Do not post in the thread until the game is over, not even a 'bah' post. There'll be a graveyard to complain in.

> Activity & Deadlines
10) This is a speed game and may therefore require you to be more active than in other games. Each player is required to post at least once every 24 hours. Treat this game as a commitment, and try your best to stay active.
11) Prods will be issued after 24 hours in a row without posting. If I keep having to prod you I'll get angry and replace you. Players may request a prod on another player, as well. I'm human and may forget, so if you want someone prodded just tell me.
11a) If you do not open a prod or post in the thread within 24 hours of the prod being sent I will begin looking for a replacement.
12) Things come up in life, if you need time off for something, please let myself and the players know in-thread for V/LA purposes. I will be flexible, but if you can't be here for a significant amount of time I will replace you.
13) Deadlines for each game day will be 72 hours unless specified as otherwise.
14) In the event of a deadline ending without a player gaining a majority of votes, there will be a no lynch.
15) Nights will have a 24 hour deadline. If you fail to send in a night choice, I will automatically default to 'no choice' for that night, and you will do nothing.
16) Deadlines will only be extended if I need a number of replacements, or barring some other freak circumstances. Apart from that laziness, or anything else, will not result in a deadline extension.

> Other Information
pre-17) No mechanism or website may be used to prove that a decision was achieved randomly. I.e. you may chose who claims first by rolling a dice, but you'll have to trust the person who rolled the dice not to lie.
17) Bold text is reserved for mod communication. Do not bold anything but your votes and communication you need me to see. You may use any colors as long as they are easily read by your other players/myself.
18) I will try to post Vote Counts as often as possible. Hopefully on the top of every page. If you feel a vote count is needed, don’t hesitate to ask for one, and I’ll provide one at the next opportunity.
19) It's more than possible I've missed a rule or haven't completely covered something. Don't try to exploit it, or I will punish you. If something is fuzzy for you, please ask!
20) I reserve the right to add more, or modify existing rules at any time. If this happens, I will let everyone know in thread.
21) Flavor in night/day write ups is just that; flavor.
22) Have fun!

You are a vanilla townie.

Abilities: None. You have only your voice and your vote.

Win Condition: You win when all threats to the town have been eliminated.
All roles are out. Confirm in thread.

The problem with Town alliances is that they're often started by scum, who (correctly) call their proposed allies Town, and thus flatter them into this alliance. Once in, they are pot-committed (poker reference) to the alliance, and feel like they have to keep taking advice and direction from their scum ally. Even when started by a genuine Townie, the likelihood that they chose 100% Townies a few days into Day 1 is pretty small, and whatever Town worm their way in can corrupt it from within with the same method.

Good example? In There Will Be Bloodshed, IceyCupcake was a Town Neighborizer. They recruited Calcifer (a VT), then TwoHeadedBoy (Godfather), then me (Goon), at which point THB and I took over and manipulated from within, killing off Calcifer before they got suspicious. THB and I rode that to a flawless scum win by manipulating a presumed-Townie alliance.

This is what initially turned me off to an unconfirmed clique that votes together. Alliances of Townies very rarely are what they think they are, or what they advertise themselves as. This one reeks to high heaven.

Lola had been with the carnival since before she could remember. Her parents had run the Snack Shack, serving up high-priced candied apples, snowcones and fresh-squeezed lemonade. She loved dipping the apples and rolling them in nuts and was thrilled the day her mother told her she was old enough to run the cotton candy machine. She was 15 now and ever since her birthday, she had been allowed to explore the carnival after hours. Lately, however, things were different. Everyone was trying to find whoever was behind the recent murders, and she had been strictly forbidden to wander alone, especially at dark. She was an obedient child, for the most part, and so it wasn't until sunrise that she found the body. An older gentleman, dressed as a maintenance worker, was lying right behind the Snack Shack. His head was haloed by a pool of blood, which had seeped out of the slit in his neck. A scream caught in Lola's throat, and she slowly stepped backward and then ran to find her parents.

YankCane151, vanilla townie, throat slit Night 1


Lola's attention was wrenched away from the dead man by someone rushing past her. She looked up to see several others running down the thoroughfare. "It's the Zipper!" someone yelled loudly. "Something's happened at the Zipper!" Confused and still reeling from the shock of seeing the dead body, she walked slowly toward the crowd gathering at the base of the tall, colorful ride. They were all looking up and soon Lola was close enough to see what held their attention. A body was dangling from one of the buckets, high in the air.

I picked kind of an unlucky time to join a speed game, I've got a shiteload of work shifts all this week that came at short notice (I'm filling in for a full time lady that's sick). I've been keeping up with the reading but I can only post intermittently.

As far as my question about town on town violence goes: you said I was scummy for fencesitting when I said that both Beck and SensFan were town, so I just wanted to make sure that you were aware of the phenomenon of town players arguing with each other because that is how I read that situation and I wasn't sure if you quite understood what I was getting at.

Hello everyone, I have a few things I'd like to say. The first is a little background on me so that you can understand me and my playstyle a little bit more.

Background on me(because it could prove useful in understanding how to read me): I had 1 year of EM experience and like 2 games of Forum Mafia experience. I am very used to the fast-paced reaction based style of play and it has been strange adjusting to Forum Mafia, however I feel like I am making a pretty strong shift from the former to the latter.

I am not a fan of meta although I know that it is used by people a lot and may even catch scum. But any decent player won't give you a link to a game that will incriminate them, that's just silly. Regardless I won't insult your use of it I will even accept it and even use it myself, I just dislike dependence on it and I dislike it in general.

TwistedSpoons in our last game together (got mod kiled by the way, I have read the site rules though, so that shouldn't be a problem this game. I've never broken the rules in a way in which I had no idea I was breaking the rules before) I posted a ton and gave in depth reads on everyone. This game will be different as it is a speed game. My reason for saying this is that it is a segway into the fact that my way of playing is different than yours most likely. I take a ton of notes and analyze everything to the letter. If you think I'm posting fluff chances are it just looks like fluff and I actually have a goal in mind. Also I noticed that my post in limbo (meant to be at the end of day 1 but I slightly missed it) I forgot to say >implying I live, although i doubt scum will kill me n1 due to the fact that I just entered the game and it'd be a huge dick move especially when there are viable options that aren't me. Anyways the reason for saying this is because I will inform you now that I often will say ">implying situation A is not the case" which simply is telling you the implications I am making my post under. I do that to make it more understandable what I'm saying and it does not always reflect my opinion on the situation at hand.

Smiley and his crew had run the ferris wheel for years. It was an alright life, decent pay, if a bit repetitive at times. Things changed for Smiley last August on a busy Saturday afternoon. The ferris wheel malfunctioned and caused a young woman to drop out of one of the buckets and fall to her death. For several months, Smiley was the center of attention until it was proven that the death had been an accident. He was surprised to find that he didn't mind the suspicion that he had been behind the death, and even found himself wishing he had been, as life became dull again once the smoke cleared.

It wasn't long before Smiley realized his life would be much more exciting if he could pull off an "accident" or two. And so it began. His thrills were short lived however, as the angry crowd discovered he was one of those behind the recent deaths.
